page.title: 10DARTMOUTH SCHOOL
page.content: 100 years ago, Dartmouth School was in what is now the Guildhall. {DARTMOUTH SCHOOL and COMMMUNITY {COLLEGE}today is a comprehensive school occupying two sites, one on Victoria Road (built in 1919), and the other in Milton Lane (built in 1975). The{Victoria Road}site has seen many changes. It was an all boys school, later a mixed Secondary Modern and finally a Comprehensive School and Community College. The number of pupils on roll this year is{480.}In 1983 it was announced that the school would close in about 5 years time, because the number of pupils was expected to drop below that for which a comprehensive curriculum could be maintained. The{community contested the figures and protested so strongly that the school was saved subject to a review.
